columns.text: In this problem, we need to determine the reduction in outstanding cash balances, the dollar return that could be earned on these savings and the maximum monthly charge the company should pay.
Average daily collections are $\$175,000$, the required rate of return is $4\%$ per year, and the  year has a 365 days.

**a)**   The reduction in outstanding cash balances as a result of implementing
the lockbox system is 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Company float}&=\text{Average daily collections}â‹…\text{Clearing time}\\
&=\$175,000\cdot 3\hspace{2mm}\text{days}\\
&=\$525,000
\end{align*}$$
**Hence, the reduction in outstanding cash balances is $525,000.**

**b)**  First, we will find the daily average rate: 
$$\begin{align*}
r_{\text{daily}}&=\sqrt[365]{1+r}-1\\
&=\sqrt[365]{1+4}-1\\
&=\sqrt[365]{5}-1\\
&=0.004419\\
\end{align*}$$

The dollar return that could be earned on these savings is the product of daily average rate and the reduction in outstanding cash balances:
$$\begin{align*}
\text{The dollar return}&=\$525,000\cdot0.004419\\
&=\$2,320.06
\end{align*}$$
**Hence, the dollar return that could be earned on these savings is $2,320.06.**

**c)** Converting the annual rate to a monthly rate we get 

$$\begin{align*}
r_{\text{monthly}}&=\sqrt[12]{1+r}-1\\
&=\sqrt[12]{1+4}-1\\
&=\sqrt[12]{5}-1\\
&=0.14353\\
\end{align*}$$

To find the maximum monthly charge the company should pay  if the payment is due at the end of the month use the following formula 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Maximum monthly charge}&=\text{Company float}\cdot{\text{Monthly interest rate}}\\
&=\$525,000\cdot0.14353\\
&=\$75,353.16
\end{align*}$$
**Hence, the maximum monthly charge the company should pay, if the payment is due at the end of the month, is $75,353.16.**

If the payment is due at the beginning of the month, then the maximum monthly charge the company should pay is 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Maximum monthly charge}&=\frac{\text{Company float}\cdot{\text{Monthly interest rate}}}{1+\text{Monthly interest rate}}\\[15pt]
&=\frac{\$525,000\cdot0.14353}{1+0.14353}\\[15pt]
&=\frac{\$75,353.16}{1.14353}\\[15pt]
&=\$65,895.22
\end{align*}$$
**Hence, the maximum monthly charge the company should pay, if the payment is due at the beginning of the month, is $65,895.22.**
